abstract: Marina Picasso, alienated granddaughter of Pablo Picasso, will sell off many of the remaining 10,000 artworks she inherited to pay for her philanthropic projects; plans to sell work privately, without aid of dealers or auctioneers, leading many in art world to worry that she could flood international art market and lower prices.
lead_paragraph: A decision by a granddaughter of Picasso to sell many of his works privately has led to speculation that she could flood the market and depress prices.

headline.main: Picasso’s Granddaughter Plans to Sell Art, Worrying the Market
headline.print_headline: Heir to 10,000 Picassos, Ready to Be Rid of Some

snippet: A decision by a granddaughter of Picasso to sell many of his works privately has led to speculation that she could flood the market and depress prices.
